results.description: SUGGESTION1: used multiple fields (rel_ret_comp + rel_num_comp). SUGGESTION2: rel_ret_comp is scalar so vec not applied. SUGGESTION3: both fields have coverage >0.6 so ts_backfill not used. SUGGESTION4: rel_ret_comp and rel_num_comp have high user/alpha counts so preferred. Kept KEEP_IN_MINDs by using only 2 datafields and 2 operators. Confidence: 0.78 (reason: direct relation between competitors' returns and instrument performance).

SUGGESTION1: combined rel_ret_comp and pv13_revere_index_cap to control for size. SUGGESTION2: no vector ops needed. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: used pv13_revere_index_cap (high userCount). Kept implementation compact. Confidence: 0.70 (moderate evidence for reversal after competitor moves).

results.idea: Average PageRank of competitors as network centrality alpha
results.description: SUGGESTION1: used pv13_com_page_rank (vector). SUGGESTION2: applied vec_avg() to vector field. SUGGESTION3: coverage high so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: high user/alpha counts used. Respects KEEP_IN_MIND by single datafield and <=7 operators. Confidence: 0.66 (network centrality often predictive).

SUGGESTION1: combined pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank (vector) and rel_ret_cust. SUGGESTION2: vec_avg applied to auth_rank. SUGGESTION3: rel_ret_cust coverage <0.6 so ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust, 5) applied. SUGGESTION4: used high-user vector where available. Kept under 2 datafields and few operators. Confidence: 0.60 (data sparsity reduces confidence).

SUGGESTION1: used pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank (vector) with ts_returns. SUGGESTION2: vec_avg used. SUGGESTION3: coverage high so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: moderate userCount used. Kept operators small. Confidence: 0.62 (hub momentum can indicate information flow).

SUGGESTION1: used pv13_revere_key_sector_total and pv13_revere_index_cap to control for size. SUGGESTION2: no vector fields. SUGGESTION3: coverages are 1.0 so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: both fields high userCount/alphaCount. Kept operators <=7. Confidence: 0.73 (stable signals from sector focus).

SUGGESTION1: rel_ret_comp combined with pv13_revere_index_cap for size-adjustment. SUGGESTION2: no vec. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: used high-use fields. Kept concise. Confidence: 0.75 (size-adjusted competitor signals are robust).

results.idea: Partners' return momentum scaled by partner count
results.description: SUGGESTION1: combined rel_ret_part and rel_num_part. SUGGESTION2: neither are vectors. SUGGESTION3: both coverage >0.6 so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: rel_num_part high userCount. Kept operators simple. Confidence: 0.71 (partners often transmit demand shocks).

results.idea: Instrument vs average of its related entities (customers+competitors)
results.description: SUGGESTION1: combined rel_ret_all and pv13_revere_index_cap. SUGGESTION2: rel_ret_all scalar. SUGGESTION3: rel_ret_all coverage high so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: used high alphaCount field. Kept <=2 datafields. Confidence: 0.68.

results.idea: High customer PageRank with rising customer returns

SUGGESTION1: used pv13_com_rk_au (vector) only. SUGGESTION2: vec_avg applied. SUGGESTION3: coverage high so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: strong user/alpha counts. Kept minimal. Confidence: 0.67.

SUGGESTION1: pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank and pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank combined. SUGGESTION2: vec_avg on both. SUGGESTION3: coverage >0.6 so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: moderate counts. Used subtraction to capture divergence. Confidence: 0.64.

SUGGESTION1: used pv13_revere_index_value vs pv13_revere_index_cap. SUGGESTION2: no vec. SUGGESTION3: both coverage 1.0 so no backfill. SUGGESTION4: index cap high userCount. Confidence: 0.69 (index value scaled by cap can show momentum).

SUGGESTION1: pv13_revere_term_sector_total combined with rel_ret_comp. SUGGESTION2: term sector total scalar. SUGGESTION3: coverage 1.0 for term_sector_total so no backfill; rel_ret_comp high coverage. SUGGESTION4: used high alphaCount. Confidence: 0.65.

results.idea: Parent-sector momentum adjusted by parent level
results.description: SUGGESTION1: pv13_revere_parent (group id) used as group parameter and pv13_revere_level as scalar. SUGGESTION2: no vec. SUGGESTION1: last_diff_value(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), 7) to detect recent stable/unstable changes. SUGGESTION2: vec_avg used. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: simple implementation. Confidence: 0.58.

SUGGESTION1: group_rank(ts_zscore(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust, 5), 21), pv13_revere_zipcode) using backfill for rel_ret_cust. SUGGESTION2: group operator used. SUGGESTION3: applied ts_backfill. SUGGESTION4: coverage limits confidence. Confidence: 0.53.

SUGGESTION1: divide(pv13_revere_key_sector_total, ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp, 21)) to capture breadth vs returns. SUGGESTION2: no vec. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: fields high userCount. Confidence: 0.62.

SUGGESTION1: bucket(quantile(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank)), range="0,1,0.1") to bucket centrality. SUGGESTION2: vec_avg used. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: bucket reduces noise. Confidence: 0.61.
SUGGESTION1: ts_ir(ts_delay(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank),1), 63). SUGGESTION2: vec_avg and ts_delay used. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: small operator count. Confidence: 0.57.
SUGGESTION1: zscore(ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp, 5)) as nested zscores to remove cross-sectional mean. SUGGESTION2: no vec. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: simple and robust. Confidence: 0.69.
SUGGESTION1: ts_max_diff(rel_ret_part, 5) used to detect local drawdowns. SUGGESTION2: no vec. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: concise implementation. Confidence: 0.65.

SUGGESTION1: multiply(rel_num_comp, pv13_revere_term_sector_total) to amplify competition in terminal sectors. SUGGESTION2: no vec. SUGGESTION3: coverages OK. SUGGESTION4: uses strong fields. Confidence: 0.64.

SUGGESTION1: group_rank(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank), pv13_revere_country). SUGGESTION2: vec_avg used and grouped by country. SUGGESTION3: coverages OK. SUGGESTION4: group used properly. Confidence: 0.6.
SUGGESTION1: ts_zscore(ts_mean(rel_num_part, 21), 63) smooths partner count then zscores. SUGGESTION2: no vec. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: stable indicator. Confidence: 0.66.

results.idea: Competitor authority relative rank within country
results.description: SUGGESTION1: group_rank(ts_zscore(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au), 21), pv13_revere_country). SUGGESTION2: vec_avg used and grouped. SUGGESTION3: coverages OK. SUGGESTION4: group used per KEEP_IN_MIND4. Confidence: 0.63.

SUGGESTION1: ts_zscore(ts_mean(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust, 7), 5), 63) backfilling then smoothing. SUGGESTION2: applied ts_backfill for low coverage. SUGGESTION3: careful with sparse data. SUGGESTION4: still compact. Confidence: 0.55.
SUGGESTION1: ts_rank(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), 21) to rank recent values. SUGGESTION2: vec_avg used. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: small operator set. Confidence: 0.62.
SUGGESTION1: subtract(ts_zscore(rel_ret_part, 5), ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp, 5)). SUGGESTION2: no vec. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: simple difference. Confidence: 0.66.
SUGGESTION1: quantile(rel_num_comp) to place competitor counts in cross-sectional context. SUGGESTION2: no vec. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: robust and simple. Confidence: 0.7.

SUGGESTION1: multiply(ts_zscore(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank), 21), ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp, 5)). SUGGESTION2: vec_avg used. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: combines network and market moves. Confidence: 0.63.

SUGGESTION1: winsorize(zscore(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank)), std=3) to limit outliers then rank across cross-section. SUGGESTION2: vec_avg used. SUGGESTION3: coverage OK. SUGGESTION4: robust transformation. Confidence: 0.65.
